item.description:
Known also as Flower Festival, this holiday celebrates the birth of the historical Buddha in Lumbini Garden over 2,500 years ago. It is said that when the this baby was born, flowers bloomed, birds sang and sweet rain fell from the heavens.  This family event includes multi-media presentation of the Buddha's birth, flower ceremony, and the ritual of pouring sweet tea over the statute of the baby buddha. Please, bring a flower as an offering to the baby buddha if you wish to participate in the flower ceremony. Lead by Senpai Sensei.

This date also comemorates the 10th year anniversary of the Buddhist Faith Fellowship which was found by Senpai Sensei in an apartment in Bristol, Connecticut. Today this community is the largest Shin community in New England and has chapters in many states.


Visit our main website  at www.bffct.net for Calendar and more information on our beliefs and practices.

 

p.s. REMINDER - Hosted by the Buddhist Faith Fellowship. Even though just one or two people from Meetup have RSVPed, you can expect 35 - 45 people in attendance.
